awd_titl_txt: High Capacity Atomic-Level Simulations for Design of        Materials
awd_abstract_narration: The Grand Challenge Application Groups competition provides one                 mechanism for the support of multidisciplinary teams of scientists              and engineers to meet the goals of the High Performance Computing               and Communications (HPCC) Initiative in Fiscal Year 1992.  The                  ideal proposal provided not only excellence in science: focussed                problem with potential for substantial impact in a critical area of             science and engineering but also significant interactions between               scientific and computational scientist, that would have impact in               high-performance computational activity beyond the specific                     scientific or engineering problem area(s) or discipline being                   studied.                                                                                                                                                        The methodology of quantum chemistry, molecular dynamics, and solid             state theory should, in principle, allow predictions of the                     physical, chemical and electronic properties of materials.  This                project will focus on bridging the gap between current                          methodologies for atomic-level simulations of simulations and the               level required for accurately describing the important properties               of real materials.                                                                                                                                              Methodologies that will be explored for the high capacity atomic                level simulations, with implementations on parallel computers,                  include: the Cell Multipol (CMM); Hessian-Based Singular Valued                 Decomposition (HB/SVD); and the Pseudospectral Generalized valence              Bond(PS-GVB) method.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
